inclusion.criterion: Patients aged from 20 up to 70 years old.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Patients of American Society of Anesthesiologists (ASA) physical status grade I and II.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Admitted for pain management of their unilateral lower limb radicular pain due to lumbo-sacral disc prolapse confirmed by lumbo-sacral magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) after failure of conservative treatments in the form of drug therapy and physiotherapy to control the pain for 6 weeks.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Patients are going to be divided according to the injected drugs into two equal groups (50 patients each):
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: criteria are patients with axial back pain without leg radiation, patients with motor neurological deficits, previous spine surgeries, allergy to the study drugs used, uncontrolled diabetes mellitus or hypertension, local or systemic infection, pregnancy, and patients with any other neurological deficits as cauda equina.
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: The patient has had positive history of sickle cell crises since childhood.
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: Patient is a 34-year-old African American man with severe bone pain due to sickle cell disease. He has had previous episodes of sickle cell crises and was treated with oxycodone, which was not beneficial.
